name: Privacy Rule
description: Controls use and disclosure of Protected Health Information
long_description: The Privacy Rule establishes national standards to protect patient health information privacy. It defines permitted and non-permitted uses and disclosures of PHI, grants individuals rights to access and amend their health information, and sets requirements for covered entities and business associates.
primary_requirements: Use and Disclosure Controls; Individual Rights; Minimum Necessary Standard; Authorization Requirements; Privacy Safeguards; Workforce Training

name: Security Rule
description: Requires administrative, physical, and technical safeguards for Electronic Protected Health Information
long_description: The Security Rule establishes national standards and procedures for protecting Electronic PHI (ePHI). It requires covered entities and business associates to implement administrative, physical, and technical safeguards to ensure confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI. The rule includes specific requirements for risk assessment, access controls, encryption, audit controls, and incident response.
primary_requirements: Risk Assessment and Management; Administrative Safeguards; Physical Safeguards; Technical Safeguards; Workforce Security; Access Controls; Encryption; Audit Logging; Incident Response; Contingency Planning

name: Breach Notification Rule
description: Establishes procedures for notifying individuals when their Protected Health Information is compromised
long_description: The Breach Notification Rule requires covered entities and business associates to notify individuals when unsecured PHI is acquired by unauthorized persons. The rule defines what constitutes a breach, requires risk assessment to determine if breach notification is necessary, and specifies notification procedures, timelines, and content requirements for notifications to individuals, media, and the Department of Health and Human Services.
primary_requirements: Breach Detection and Assessment; Risk Assessment; Notification to Individuals; Notification to Media; Notification to HHS; Mitigation Services; Documentation

name: Administrative Simplification Rule
cfr_parts: 45 CFR Part 160; 45 CFR Part 162; 45 CFR Part 164
description: Establishes standards for electronic healthcare transactions and code sets
long_description: The Administrative Simplification provisions establish national standards for electronic healthcare transactions, code sets, identifiers, and operating rules. These standards promote electronic exchange of health information and improve administrative efficiency. Includes standards for transactions such as claims, eligibility inquiry and response, referral authorization and inquiry, and electronic funds transfer.
primary_requirements: Electronic Transaction Standards; Code Set Standards; Identifier Standards; Operating Rules Compliance

name: HIPAA Enforcement Rule
description: Establishes procedures for investigation and enforcement of HIPAA violations
long_description: The Enforcement Rule establishes procedures for HHS Office for Civil Rights (OCR) to investigate HIPAA violations, assess civil penalties, and take enforcement actions. It defines violation categories, penalty tiers, and procedures for entities to resolve violations through corrective action plans. The rule provides appeal rights and establishes minimum penalties for willful neglect.
primary_requirements: Violation Investigation; Civil Penalty Assessment; Corrective Action Plans; Compliance Reporting
